com.cyc.baseclient

Interface KbTransaction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleKbTransaction

    public interface KbTransaction
    Defines the interface for KB Transaction, which provide support similar to that of database transactions.
    Author:
    daves

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void begin()
      Begin the KBTransaction.
      void commit()
      Commit all of the KB modification operations that have occurred within this transaction.
      void noteCreation(Fort term)
      Note in the transaction that term has been created.
      void noteForAssertion(String sentence, ElMt mt, boolean bookkeeping, boolean transcripting, boolean wffCheckingDisabled, List<Fort> templates)
      Assign to the transaction the job of asserting sentence with the relevant parameters.
      void noteForUnassertion(String sentence, ElMt mt, boolean bookkeeping, boolean transcripting)
      Assign to the transaction the job of asserting sentence with the relevant parameters.
      void rollback()
      Roll back any KB modifications that occurred while this KBTransaction was active.

    • Method Detail

      • begin

        void begin()
        Begin the KBTransaction. Supported KB modification operations will be recorded and available for rollback if needed.

      • commit

        void commit()
        Commit all of the KB modification operations that have occurred within this transaction. If there are any failures, a BaseClientRuntimeException will be thrown. After commit() has returned (whether normally or by throwing an exception), this KBTransaction will no longer be active.

      • rollback

        void rollback()
        Roll back any KB modifications that occurred while this KBTransaction was active. After rollback(), this KBTransaction will no longer be active.

      • noteForAssertion

        void noteForAssertion(String sentence,
                      ElMt mt,
                      boolean bookkeeping,
                      boolean transcripting,
                      boolean wffCheckingDisabled,
                      List<Fort> templates)
        Assign to the transaction the job of asserting sentence with the relevant parameters.
        Parameters:
        sentence - The sentence to be asserted.
        mt - The Microtheory in which to make the assertion
        bookkeeping - If true, bookkeeping will be stored along with the assertion.
        transcripting - If true, the new assertion will be added to the Cyc server's transcript.
        wffCheckingDisabled - If true, the assertion will be made to the Cyc server without any semantic well-formedness checking.
        templates - A list of creationTemplates that should be used when making this assertion.

      • noteForUnassertion

        void noteForUnassertion(String sentence,
                        ElMt mt,
                        boolean bookkeeping,
                        boolean transcripting)
        Assign to the transaction the job of asserting sentence with the relevant parameters.
        Parameters:
        sentence - The sentence to be unasserted
        mt - The microtheory from which sentence should be unasserted
        bookkeeping - Should bookkeeping be made when unasserting?
        transcripting - Should the unassertion be added to the Cyc server transcript?

      • noteCreation

        void noteCreation(Fort term)
        Note in the transaction that term has been created. Unlike noteForAssertion and noteForUnassertion, noteCreation does not take over the creation of the constant. Instead it merely remembers on the transaction that this constant has been created inside the transaction, so it can be unwound as necessary if the transaction is rolled back.
        Parameters:
        term - The constant that was created
